title: SendFlowr Timing Decision
description: Canonical output of the SendFlowr Timing Layer. Represents a precise, latency-aware send trigger decision.

decision_id.description: Globally unique identifier for this timing decision (UUID or ULID).

universal_user_id.description: SendFlowr universal user identifier resolved via identity contract.

target_minute_utc.description: Canonical minute slot (0â€“10079) representing intended inbox arrival time in UTC.

trigger_timestamp_utc.description: Exact UTC timestamp when the send trigger must be fired to compensate for latency.

latency_estimate_seconds.description: Observed or predicted ESP processing latency used to compute trigger time.

confidence_score.description: Normalized confidence in the timing decision, derived from curve sharpness and signal strength.

model_version.description: Version identifier of the timing model used to generate this decision.

explanation_ref.description: Opaque reference key to an explainability record or audit log entry.

created_at_utc.description: Timestamp when the timing decision was generated.

debug.description: Optional debug payload for internal inspection and glass-box UI.

base_curve_peak_minute.description: Minute slot where the base probability curve peaks.

signal.description: Name of contextual signal applied (e.g., shopify_browse, support_ticket).

weight.description: Weight applied to the base curve for this signal.

suppressed.description: Indicates whether a circuit breaker forced propensity to zero.
